  Item 3.03.  Material Modification to Rights of Security Holders.  
                                                                    
On March 12, 2024, JPMorgan Chase & Co. (the “Company”) issued 250,000 shares (the “Shares”) of the         
Company’s 6.875% Fixed-Rate Reset Non-CumulativePreferred Stock, Series NN, par value of $1.00 per share and
with a liquidation preference of $10,000 per share (the “Series NN Preferred Stock”), which Shares were     
deposited against delivery of depositary receipts (the “Depositary Receipts”) evidencing 2,500,000          
depositary shares (the “Depositary Shares”), each representing a one-tenthinterest in a Share, issued by    
Computershare Inc., as depositary. Under the terms of the Series NN Preferred Stock, the ability of the     
Company to pay dividends on, make distributions with respect to, or to redeem, purchase or acquire, or make 
a liquidation payment on its common stock or any preferred stock ranking on a parity with or junior to the  
Series NN Preferred Stock, will be subject to restrictions in the event that the Company does not declare   
dividends on the Series NN Preferred Stock for the most recently completed dividend period or, in the case  
of any such liquidation payment, does not pay to holders of the Series NN Preferred Stock liquidation       
distributions of $10,000 per Share, plus any declared and unpaid dividends. The terms of the Series NN      
Preferred Stock are more fully described in the Certificate of Designations (as defined below), which       
establishes the rights, preferences, privileges, qualifications, restrictions and limitations relating to   
the Series NN Preferred Stock. Copies of the Certificate of Designations and the form of certificate        
representing the Series NN Preferred Stock are included as Exhibit 3.1 and Exhibit 4.1, respectively, to    
this Current Report on Form 8-Kand are incorporated by reference herein. The terms of the Depositary Shares 
are set forth in the Deposit Agreement, dated March 12, 2024, among the Company, Computershare Inc., as     
depositary, and the holders from time to time of the Depositary Receipts issued thereunder (the “Deposit    
Agreement”) and the form of Depositary Receipt. Copies of the Deposit Agreement and the form of Depositary  
Receipt are included as Exhibit 4.2 and Exhibit 4.3, respectively, to this Current Report on Form 8-Kand are
incorporated by reference herein.                                                                           
                                                                                         
  Item 5.03.  Amendments to Articles of Incorporation or Bylaws; Change in Fiscal Year.  
                                                                                         
On March 11, 2024, the Company filed a Certificate of Designations, Powers, Preferences and Rights with the 
Secretary of State of the State of Delaware, establishing the rights, preferences, privileges,              
qualifications, restrictions and limitations relating to the Series NN Preferred Stock (the “Certificate of 
Designations”). The Certificate of Designations became effective with the Secretary of State of the State of
Delaware upon filing. A copy of the Certificate of Designations is included as Exhibit 3.1 to this Current  
Report on Form 8-Kand is incorporated by reference herein.                                                  
                             
  Item 8.01.  Other Events.  
                             
On March 12, 2024, the Company completed the issuance and sale of 250,000 Shares, which Shares were         
deposited against delivery of Depositary Receipts evidencing 2,500,000 Depositary Shares, pursuant to an    
Underwriting Agreement, dated March 5, 2024, among the Company, J.P. Morgan Securities LLC and the other    
several underwriters named therein. The sale of the Depositary Shares was made pursuant to the Company’s    
Registration Statement on Form S-3(File No. 333-263304),as amended. In connection with this offering, the   
legal opinion as to the legality of the Depositary Shares and the Series NN Preferred Stock is being filed  
as Exhibit 5.1 to this Current Report on Form 8-K.
